workflow.name: Extract medical reports & generate AI health advice with Mistral AI & GPT-4
workflow.description:
## Try It Out!

Use n8n to extract medical test data from diagnostic reports uploaded to Google Drive, automatically detect abnormal values, and generate personalized health advice.

### How it works

1. Upload a medical report (PDF or image) to a monitored Google Drive folder
2. Mistral AI extracts text using OCR while preserving document structure
3. GPT-4 parses the extracted text into structured JSON (patient info, test names, results, units, reference ranges)
4. All test results are saved to the "All Values" sheet in Google Sheets
5. JavaScript code compares each result against its reference range to detect abnormalities
6. For out-of-range values, GPT-4 generates personalized dietary, lifestyle, and exercise advice based on patient age and gender
7. Abnormal results with recommendations are saved to the "Out of Range Values" sheet

### How to use

1. Set up Google Drive folder monitoring and Google Sheets with two tabs: "All Values" and "Out of Range Values"
2. Configure API credentials for Google Drive, Mistral AI, and OpenAI (GPT-4)
3. Upload medical reports to your monitored folder
4. Review extracted data and personalized health advice in Google Sheets

### Requirements

* Google Drive and Sheets with OAuth2 authentication
* Mistral AI API key for OCR
* OpenAI API key (GPT-4 access required) for intelligent extraction and advice generation

### Need Help?

* See the detailed Read Me file at https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Wv7dfcBLsHZlPcy1QWPYk6XSyrS3H534/view?usp=sharing
* Join the n8n community forum for support

workflow.name: Extract Medical reports from Google Drive with AI health advice

nodes.name: Upload pdf/jpeg file to Google drive
nodes.notes:
Folder ID is referenced from the 'Workflow User Configuration'
Folder ID is read from workflow variable `GOOGLE_DRIVE_FOLDER_ID` (set via Workflow ‚Üí Settings ‚Üí Variables). You can also replace the expression directly in this field.

values.content:
=You are an expert medical data extraction assistant specializing in diagnostic reports. Your role is to accurately identify and extract EVERY measurable test result (including all sub-parameters of multi-test panels like LFT, Haemogram, Lipid Profile, etc.) in a granular and structured fashion, for each page of the provided document.
Return only pure, valid JSON and ensure your output is reliable for direct ingestion by downstream data pipelines.

=Extract ALL individual test results (including every sub-parameter of multi-panel tests such as Liver Function Test, Haemogram, etc.) from the ENTIRE provided document. 

Output instructions:
- For EACH test or parameter, create a JSON object with these fields: 
  - diagnostic_centre: Name of the diagnostic center
  - patient_name: Full patient name
  - age: age of the patient in Years
  - gender: gender of the patient
  - registration_date: Registration date (DD-MMM-YYYY)
  - sample_type: Type of sample (e.g., Serum, Plasma, Urine)
  - test_name: Name of the specific test/parameter (e.g., 'Total Bilirubin', 'SGPT', 'Hemoglobin', etc.)
  - result_value: Result value (only the numeric or string value, no additional text)
  - unit: Unit of measurement, if present (e.g., mg/dL, g/L, etc.)
  - reference_range: Normal reference range, if present

- Return ONLY a valid JSON array of all detected test results/parameters. 
- Do not include any markdown, formatting, or code blocks‚Äîjust the raw JSON array.
- If a field is missing for a parameter, output an empty string ("").

Example:
[
  {
    "diagnostic_centre": "VIJAYA DIAGNOSTIC CENTRE",
    "patient_name": "Mr.XYZ",
    "age": "58 Years",
    "gender": "Male",
    "registration_date": "26-Jan-2024",
    "sample_type": "Fluoride Plasma",
    "test_name": "Post Lunch Glucose",
    "result_value": "236",
    "unit": "mg/dL",
    "reference_range": "100-140"
  },
  {
    "diagnostic_centre": "VIJAYA DIAGNOSTIC CENTRE",
    "patient_name": "Mr.XYZ",
    "age": "58 Years",
    "gender": "Male",
    "registration_date": "26-Jan-2024",
    "sample_type": "Serum",
    "test_name": "Total Bilirubin",
    "result_value": "0.8",
    "unit": "mg/dL",
    "reference_range": "0.3-1.2"
  }
]

Reference {{ $json.combined_markdown }} to provide the full multi-page text as input.


Extract every possible test entry into a single JSON array, without markdown, code fences, or comments. Every result/parameter from every page must be present as a separate object.
You are a physician-reviewed expert assistant specializing in actionable, personalized wellness guidance based on lab test results.

parameters.content:
## Google Drive Trigger

## Upload file (Pdf/Image)

Monitors a specific Google Drive folder for newly uploaded medical reports (PDF/image files). Triggers the workflow when a new file is detected (checks every minute).

## Download File

Downloads the detected medical report file from Google Drive for processing.

## Check if PDF/Image

Determines whether the uploaded file is a PDF or an image, routing to the appropriate extraction node.

## Extract from PDF

Uses Mistral AI to extract text and structure from PDF medical reports using OCR capabilities.










































## Extract from Image

Uses Mistral AI to extract text from image-based medical reports (JPG, PNG, etc.) using vision capabilities.

## Extract Medical Data (AI)

Uses GPT-4 to intelligently extract structured data from the medical report: patient details, test names, results, units, and reference ranges. Outputs pure JSON.







































## Combine page Markdown
 Merges markdown text from all pages of multi-page reports into a single combined text for unified processing.



## Parse AI output to one-per-row
 Transforms the AI-generated JSON array into individual n8n items  (one per test result), cleans reference intervals, and standardizes field names for Google Sheets compatibility.

## Generate Health Advice (AI) 

Uses GPT-4 to generate personalized dietary, lifestyle, and exercise recommendations for each out-of-range test result, considering patient age and gender.







































## Out-of-Range Detection & Advice Fields
Analyzes each test result against its reference range. Identifies abnormal values and routes them for personalized health advice generation.




                                                                                                                                                                                                     
## Merge AI Response Back
Combines the AI-generated health advice with the corresponding medical test data, preparing complete records for final storage.

## Save Out-of-Range Results

Saves abnormal test results along with personalized health advice to the "Out of Range Values" sheet in Google Sheets for priority review.












































 ## Save All Test Results

Saves every extracted test result to the "All Values" sheet in Google Sheets for comprehensive record-keeping.

## Try It Out!

Use n8n to extract medical test data from diagnostic reports uploaded to Google Drive, automatically detect abnormal values, and generate personalized health advice.

### How it works

1. Upload a medical report (PDF or image) to a monitored Google Drive folder
2. Mistral AI extracts text using OCR while preserving document structure
3. GPT-4 parses the extracted text into structured JSON (patient info, test names, results, units, reference ranges)
4. All test results are saved to the "All Values" sheet in Google Sheets
5. JavaScript code compares each result against its reference range to detect abnormalities
6. For out-of-range values, GPT-4 generates personalized dietary, lifestyle, and exercise advice based on patient age and gender
7. Abnormal results with recommendations are saved to the "Out of Range Values" sheet

### How to use

1. Set up Google Drive folder monitoring and Google Sheets with two tabs: "All Values" and "Out of Range Values"
2. Configure API credentials for Google Drive, Mistral AI, and OpenAI (GPT-4)
3. Upload medical reports to your monitored folder
4. Review extracted data and personalized health advice in Google Sheets

### Requirements

* Google Drive and Sheets with OAuth2 authentication
* Mistral AI API key for OCR
* OpenAI API key (GPT-4 access required) for intelligent extraction and advice generation

### Need Help?

* See the detailed setup guide for step-by-step credential configuration
* Join the n8n community forum for support

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
